reference.text: holograms, e.g. point holograms, used as ordinary optical elements G02B5/32; producing stereoscopic or other three-dimensional effects G02B27/22; diffraction-grating systems G02B27/44; systems using moirè fringes G02B27/60; optical logic elements G02F3/00; stereo-photography G03B35/00; photosensitive materials or processes for photographic purposes G03C;

; apparatus for processing exposed photographic materials G03D; analogue computers performing mathematical operations with the aid of optical elements G06E3/00; authentication by radiation, of concealed information carried by holograms or diffraction gratings G06K19/16; holographic storage G11B7/0065, G11C13/04;

CPC-specific-text.text: stereoscopic or other three dimensional effects in television systems H04N13/00

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers means for producing a record of the phase and amplitude information of a wave-front, which information can be used to reconstruct the original wave-front, or means to reconstruct the original wave-front from a record containing the phase and amplitude information of the wave-front.

title-part.text: Covert holograms or holobjects requiring additional knowledge to be perceived, e.g. holobject reconstructed only under IR illumination
Deciphering being performed with numerical or optical key, e.g. with the optical scrambler used during recording

reference.text: optical element in object beam G03H1/041

title-part.text: Being copy-protected against fraudulent replication, e.g. by layering a filter rejecting laser lines
in hologrammetry for measuring or analysing

reference.text: holographic interferometry G01B9/021; investigating particles G01N15/0227
holographic rain sensor in vehicles B60S1/084

title-part.text: in microscopy, e.g. digital holographic microscope [DHM]
in haptic applications when the observer interacts with the holobject
for wavefront matching wherein the hologram is arranged to convert a predetermined wavefront into a comprehensive wave, e.g. associative memory
for wavefront conjugation wherein the hologram generates a wavefront conjugating a predetermined object, e.g. null testing, positioning, comparative holography
for optical manipulation, e.g. holographic optical tweezers [HOT]
for restoring distorted objects, e.g. restoring objects through scattering media
for video-holography, i.e. integrating hologram acquisition, transmission and display
for patterning or machining using the holobject as input light distribution

title-part.text: Processes or apparatus for producing holograms
for recording single beam Lippmann hologram wherein the object is illuminated by reference beam passing through the recording material
for recording combined transmission and reflection holograms
Restricted parallax, e.g. horizontal parallax only holograms [HPO]
Extended parallax, e.g. panoramic or 360deg. holograms
Image holography, i.e. an image of the object or holobject is recorded

reference.text: G03H1/0406 takes precedence; holographic microscope G03H2001/005

title-part.text: Non planar recording surface, e.g. curved surface
Constrained record wherein, during exposure, the recording means undergoes constrains substantially differing from those expected at reconstruction
In situ recording when the hologram is recorded within the device used for reconstruction
Formation of interference pattern, not otherwise provided for

CPC-specific-text.text: Digital holography, i.e. recording holograms with digital recording means

title-part.text: arranged to record an image of the object
Arrangement for recovering hologram complex amplitude
Spatial heterodyne, i.e. filtering a Fourier transform of the off-axis record
Temporal or spatial phase shifting, e.g. parallel phase shifting method
Frequency heterodyne, i.e. one beam is frequency shifted

CPC-specific-text.text: Particular recording light; Beam shape or geometry

title-part.text: Gated recording using pulsed or low coherence light source, e.g. light in flight, first arriving light
Object light being reflected by the object
Object light being transmitted through the object, e.g. illumination through living cells
Particular illumination angle between object or reference beams and hologram
Serial printer i.e. point oriented processing
Parallel printer, i.e. a fringe pattern is reproduced
Arranged to produce three-dimensional fringe pattern

CPC-specific-text.text: Improving or monitoring the quality of the record, e.g. by compensating distortions, aberrations

title-part.text: by monitoring the hologram formation, e.g. via a feed-back loop

CPC-specific-text.text: Encoding method mapping the synthesized field into a restricted set of values representative of the modulator parameters, e.g. detour phase coding

title-part.text: Kinoform, i.e. phase only encoding wherein the computed field is processed into a distribution of phase differences
Cell encoding wherein each computed values is represented by at least two pixels of the modulator, e.g. detour phase coding

CPC-specific-text.text: Digital holographic imaging, i.e. synthesizing holobjects from holograms

title-part.text: Solving phase ambiguity, e.g. phase unwrapping
Particular processing of hologram record carriers, e.g. for obtaining blazed holograms

reference.text: photographic processing in general G03C, G03D

title-part.text: Swelling or shrinking the holographic record or compensation thereof e.g. for controlling the reconstructed wavelength
Trimming process i.e. macroscopically patterning the hologram
Demetallisation, i.e. removing the enhancing metallic layer
with modification of the nature of the hologram, e.g. changing from volume to surface relief or from reflection to transmission
Processes or apparatus for obtaining an optical image from holograms
Spatial filter, e.g. for suppressing higher diffraction orders
Element having optical power, e.g. field lens
Diffusing screen revealing the real holobject, e.g. container filed with gel to reveal the 3D holobject
Screen having complex surface, e.g. a structured object
Particular relationship between light source, hologram and observer
adapted for reflection and transmission reconstruction
Means for detecting or recording the holobject
for testing the hologram or holobject
Holobject out of Fourier or hologram planes
Pseudo-dynamic holobject, e.g. due to angle multiplexing and viewer motion
Superimposing the holobject with other visual information
when reconstruction wavelength differs form recording wavelength

CPC-specific-text.text: Addressing the hologram to an active spatial light modulator

title-part.text: using frame sequential, e.g. for reducing speckle noise
Processes or apparatus specially adapted to produce multiple
holograms or to obtain images from them, e.g. multicolour technique
Arrangement of the sub-holograms, e.g. partial overlapping
in physical contact, i.e. layered holograms
Mixed volume and surface relief holograms

CPC-specific-text.text: Multiplexing processes, e.g. aperture, shift, or wavefront multiplexing

title-part.text: Time multiplexing, i.e. consecutive records wherein the period between records is pertinent per se
Coherence multiplexing wherein different holobjects are perceived under coherent or incoherent illumination
Phase code multiplexing, wherein the sub-holograms are multiplexed according to spatial modulation of the reference beam
Two and more than two steps recording process
Interleaved sub-holograms, e.g. three RGB sub-holograms having interleaved pixels for reconstructing coloured holobject
Modulation characteristics, e.g. amplitude, phase, polarisation
Phase modulating object, e.g. living cell
2D SLM object wherein the object beam is formed of the light modulated by the SLM
3D+2D, i.e. composition of 3D and 2D sub-objects, e.g. scene in front of planar background
3D/2D, i.e. the object is formed of stratified 2D planes, e.g. tomographic data
Occluded features resolved due to parallax selectivity
Synthetic representation, i.e. digital or optical object decomposition
from real object, e.g. using 3D scanner
Numerical processing applied to the object data other than numerical propagation
Coded object not directly interpretable, e.g. encrypted object, barcode
Having particular size, e.g. irresolvable by the eye
Multiple objects, e.g. each in different environment
Holographic object, i.e. a combination of an object and holobject
Environment affecting the recording, e.g. underwater
Light sources or light beam properties
Single or narrow bandwidth source e.g. laser, light emitting diode [LED]
Multi-wavelengths wave with discontinuous wavelength ranges
Low coherence light normally not allowing valuable record or reconstruction
Transverse intensity distribution of the light beam
Particular irradiation beam not otherwise provided for
Beam irradiating the object at recording stage
Interference beam at recording stage, i.e. following combination of object and reference beams
Geometrical property of the irradiating beam
Astigmatic beam having different focal planes
Amplitude mask, e.g. diaphragm, Louver filter
Diffuser, e.g. lens array, random phase mask
Colour filter, e.g. interferential colour filter
Optical waveguide, e.g. optical fibre, rod
Birefringent optical element, e.g. wave plate
Means providing optical delay e.g. for path length matching
Particular location or purpose of optical element
Filtering the hologram information, i.e. the fringe pattern
Writing means other than actinic light wave
Having movable pixels, e.g. micro-electromechanical systems [MEMS]
Having optical element registered to each pixel
Electro-optic or electronic components relating to digital holography
Computing or processing means, e.g. digital signal processor [DSP]
Transmission or communication means, e.g. internet protocol
Electro-optic recording means, e.g. CCD, pyroelectric sensors
Mechanical components or mechanical aspects not otherwise provided for
Handheld portable device, e.g. holographic camera, mobile holographic display
Form or shape of the hologram when not registered to the substrate
Micro-hologram not registered to the substrate
Physical parameter modulated by the hologram
Details of physical variations exhibited in the hologram
Chromatic variations e.g. photochromic or electrochromic
Optical length variations, e.g. bleached silver halide
Structural variations, e.g. structure variations due to photoanchoring or conformation variations due to photo-isomerisation
Parameters or numerical values associated with holography, e.g. peel strength
SLM related parameters, e.g. pixel size
Sampling aspect applied to sensor or display
arranged to be transferred onto a carrier body
Forming layer onto which a surface relief hologram is formed
Printed information overlapped with the hologram
Details of photosensitive recording material not otherwise provided for
Ageing or resistance of the material
Rewritable material allowing several record and erase cycles
Dynamic material where the lifetime of the recorded pattern is quasi instantaneous, the holobject is simultaneously reconstructed
Photoanisotropic reactivity wherein polarized light induces material birefringence, e.g. azo-dye doped polymer
Photochromic reactivity wherein light induces a reversible transformation between two states having different absorption spectra
Photoconductor thermoplastic reactivity wherein light is transformed into an electrostatic then into a thickness distribution
Photorefractive reactivity wherein light induces photo-generation, redistribution and trapping of charges then a modification of refractive index, e.g. photorefractive polymer
Integrated surface relief hologram without forming layer
Recording material dispersed into porous substrate
Recording material filed in recessed substrate
being an optical element, e.g. spectacles
